channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Kenilworth Road near Willesden Lane, NW6, 12th December
item.description:
Some sort of household trolley by a tree

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Willesden Lane, Kilburn, London

item.category: Fly-tip Small - Less than one bag

item.title: Broken glass on crossing island, 12th December
item.description:
I reported broken glass on this island and it was claimed to have been cleared and it has not. Many dogs go across this and it is a risk to cut feet. Why say you've done a job when it clearly hasn't been?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 121, Sevenoaks Way, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Burned out motorbike, 12th December
item.description:
Someone has set fire to a motorbike/moped and dumped it at the side of the road. There is debris, and damage to the tarmac where the road has been burned. This happened three or four days ago - 8 or 9 December. It just needs a quick clean up job please: and remove the motorbike. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Palace Road, Streatham Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: MP and councillor alerted to tipping at charity bin, 12th December
item.description:
Lots of reports since 2024 but it still happens. Charity says it empties regularly but even if true it cannot stop the associated illegal dumping Charity is provided by Southwark, according to the bin. Sort it now! I’m reporting to press and MP. Thank you-we do not want vermin and maggots.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Red Post Hill, Dulwich Village, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
